results.title: Climb
results.creator_credit: Dewitt Jones, Film Technology Company and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: This is both a realistic adventure of rock-climbing and a metaphorical ascent in which limits are tested and personal values are explored. As the two climbers express their thoughts in the narration, we watch their breathtaking progress up a sheer rock face in Yosemite Valley. We learn a few rudiments of rock-climbing and about the climbers feelings and motivations.

results.title: Cliff hanging moments from the serials
results.brief_description: A selection of three trailers from the 1920s motion picture serials and feature films: 1. The 15 chapter serial “The Steel Trail” (1923), starring William Duncan and Edith Johnson. 2. The 15 chapter serial “Captain Kidd” (1922) starring Eddie Polo. 3. “A Woman in grey” (1920) starring Arline Pretty and Henry G. Sell

results.title: Clickers club: photo adventures in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Corporate Development, Western Region and TV ED Productions and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Outlines the aims of a new photography club established throughout Victorian schools. Marg Sheehan interviews Leigh Hepburn who introduces the Project Kit, Roxanne Rodgers who explains its uses in an integrated curriculum and Gail Evans who applies the resources during a primary school class excursion to the zoo.

results.title: Clever Hiko Ichi
results.brief_description: Provides a backdrop for language arts activities such as storytelling, creative dramatics, and reading, by presenting an animated story about a little boy in medieval Japan who solves three difficult problems with a bit of applied science and personal fortitude.

results.title: Cleopatra and Antony
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, friend and lover of Caesar, Roman Emperor. He is murdered, but she has a son, Caesarion. She is determined to have Caesar’s nephew, Octavian, (Emperor of Rome), removed and Caesarean in his place. To help the process she tries to befriend Mark Antony, the great Roman warrior. Antony succumbs to Cleopatra, and their relationship becomes unbreakable. Antony declares war on Rome to bring Caesarion to the throne - but after ten years of war, does not succeed, and their tragic deaths soon follow.

results.title: Cleopatra
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
A narrated account of Cleopatra’s war against her younger brother, Ptolemy, and her later influence on Julius Caesar. The film uses paints of historical events and classical music adds dramatic effect.

results.title: Clearing up the weather
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Rob Gell, well known weather forecaster and former lecturer in Geography, discusses the weather with Peter Couchman. He describes what causes particular weather patterns, looks at various types of storm activity, and discusses “El Nino” and the “Greenhouse Effect”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Clearing the way
results.brief_description: A certain vacant allotment in Manhattan, New York, was regarded by a group of children as their own particular stamping-ground. Came the day when the building of the United Nations Organisation headquarters began on that allotment. The children, deprived of their playground, set out to find just what sort of an organisation United Nations Organisation was, and what sort of work it does.

results.title: Clear, clean water
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Outlines a new process for water purification called Sirofloc, developed by the CSIRO, and explains it in the context of Australia’s limited water resources. Looks at the first commercial plant in Perth.
